reviews.title: No Hassles
reviews.text: Our recent stay at the Lubbock Courtyard was problem free. Even though the hotel was crowded our room was very quiet. The room was large and well appointed. The new Marriott bedding is great...especially the extra pillows. The staff was very friendly and professional. The breakfast buffet was above average.....nice to have real cups and glasses as opposed to styrofoam. Another plus with this hotel is the fact that you are in walking distance of IHOP, Jason's Deli, Outback, Applebees, and Cheddars. There is also a WalMart next door.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: This is a nice option on Lubbock. Wonderful beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a typical Courtyard...just what you expect from Marriott. The staff seemed a little inexperienced and not quite up to Marriott's "at your service" attitude. Perhaps it comes from being the big fish in a small pound when it comes to choices in Lubbock.
reviews.title: Typical Courtyard
Average stay
reviews.text: This hotel was alright. It met my needs, and was clean and comfortable. But it did have its problems...
I stayed here during my business trip to Lubbock, TX. It has all the standard features of Courtyard Hotel. Nothing special.
reviews.title: Average Courtyard Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Courtyard during a big football weekend in Lubbock. The property was clean, the breakfast buffet was great, and the bed was amazing!
reviews.title: Nice staff and comfortable beds!

reviews.text: While the "special event" rate was a bit on the high side, we found the staff friendly and eager to serve. They also have a small pantry available to purchase snacks and drinks.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay
